scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
un, scionable, eye, milt, wal, le, balls, by, leeks, gal, old, ut, est, ter, trust, ances, con, let, grub

## Clues
A. (3 syllables) — the use of uttered sounds for auditory communication
B. (2 syllables) — Paper in sheets 8½ in × 14 in (215.9 mm × 355.6 mm).
C. (1 syllables) — related to onions; white cylindrical bulb and flat dark-green leaves
D. (2 syllables) — thickly covered with ingrained dirt or soot
E. (2 syllables) — the ball-shaped capsule containing the vertebrate eye
F. (3 syllables) — greatly exceeding bounds of reason or moderation
G. (2 syllables) — (used especially of persons) having lived for a relatively long time or attained a specific age
H. (2 syllables) — An e-wallet or digital wallet.
I. (1 syllables) — That upon which confidence is reposed; ground of reliance; hope.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Clues

C. (3 syllables) — DOM: closed shape with five si
D. (1 syllables) — To expel or displace (air, snot, etc) from the nose or mouth by the process above.

F. (2 syllables) — DOM: athletic shoe
G. (2 syllables) — Genuine; meaning what one says or does; heartfelt.
H. (1 syllables) — extracted from a source of supply as of minerals from the earth

Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 11 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
user, de, tanker, he, mit, stand, rood, be, sweeps, ing, ed, hadur, i, bard, duce, ing, cmb, moth, gat, cat, u, off, bom, ed, breathe, blush, ba, fix, suf

## Clues
A. (1 syllables) — Member of a tank crew, or of an armoured unit.
B. (1 syllables) — force into some kind of situation, condition, or course of action
C. (2 syllables) — To append (something) to the end of something else.
D. (3 syllables) — someone or something that is abnormally large and powerful
E. (3 syllables) — bombardment
F. (4 syllables) — make less severe or harsh
G. (2 syllables) — To obtain (something) from some source; to derive.
H. (1 syllables) — (cosmology) the cooled remnant of the hot big bang that fills the entire universe and can be observed today with an average temperature of about 2.725 kelvin
I. (2 syllables) — A warrior, especially a Turko-Mongol.
J. (4 syllables) — give an education to
K. (2 syllables) — For use at a distance sufficient from the target to allow defensive fire to be evaded.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

## Syllable Bank
